item.title: Complete The Outer Worlds 2 Trophy List—How to Get All Achievements & Trophies
item.content:encoded:
The Outer Worlds 2 trophy and achievement list has been revealed. For the completionist looking to do everything in the game, you can now get a good idea of what lies ahead of you.

As we approach the game’s release date and get your preload out of the way, many players are going to start setting up their plan of attack to get that platinum trophy.

Here is the full list of achievements and trophies in The Outer Worlds 2.

All The Outer Worlds 2 Achievements & Trophies

There are a total of 49 achievements and trophies in The Outer Worlds 2. The complete list of launch day objectives is listed below.

How Many Playthroughs of The Outer Worlds 2 are Needed for the Platinum Trophy?

As of this writing, we do not know for sure how many playthroughs are absolutely required to get all achievements and trophies in The Outer Worlds 2, but it appears that it will require at least two. If certain factions are locked off depending on your choices, it could be more.

The achievement list in this game shows that The Outer Worlds 2 follows a lot of the same methods that the original game used when it comes to achievements and trophies. 

First, difficulty achievements tied to multiple achievements are not really common for RPGs, but both games do them here. Hopefully, players who play through first on Very Hard will automatically receive the Hard trophy as well, but if it doesn’t, you will be stuck with an additional playthrough.

It appears that the max level in the game is 30, much like it was in the original, and there are a lot of collectibles to find, including 100 Pitch/Tossball cards, grounding stations, audio logs, and mural pieces. Hopefully, none of those are locked off in areas if you miss them the first time through.

Outside of that, there seem to be a lot of miscellaneous achievements and trophies in The Outer Worlds 2. Things like never buying anything in the game or getting kills in various ways. If you want the platinum in this game, you are going to have to cover a lot of ground.

Are you going to try and get the platinum trophy in The Outer Worlds 2? Let us know in the comments or on the Insider Gaming forum.

item.title: Pokémon Games and DLC Roadmap Allegedly Revealed in New Datamine
item.content:encoded:
A massive Pokémon data leak has occurred, revealing details about past and upcoming games, including a roadmap for future titles and DLC.

The Pokémon Company has fallen victim to a huge datamine, which recently provided a whole bunch of details on their Gen 10 title, Pokémon Wind and Waves. Now, new information about other Pokémon games has surfaced online, including details on Gen 11, Legends 3, a remake, and more titles.

All Pokémon Projects Currently in Development at Game Freak 

Thanks to CentroLeaks on X (formerly Twitter), we have a roadmap for future Pokémon games and DLC. Firstly, the Gen 10 title, Wind and Waves, is set to release in 2026, with a DLC arriving in 2027. Pokémon Legends 3, which is called Galar, is “releasing in 2027 or beyond. A Pokémon multi-region remake is in the works, which is planned for 2028 or beyond. Moreover, Pokopia will also receive a DLC, and Pokémon Champions was originally scheduled for a 2025 release.

Pokémon Gen 11 Release Window, Multi-Region Remake, and Legends 3: Galar Details Surface Online

Players must’ve seen mentions of the multi-region remake, Legends 3: Galar, and more, and must be wondering what all that’s about. Here’s what CentroLeaks has shared about them on X:

  • Starting with Pokémon Gen 11, has seemingly set a 2030 release window, according to leaks.
  • Secondly, Game Freak is reportedly developing a multi-region Pokémon remake that lets players “walk from Sinnoh to Hoenn” and includes Kitakami. It is called Project Seed internally and is “a prototyping project for a next-generation online game playable by multiple people, set in a region that connects Hoenn and Sinnoh.”
  • Lastly, Pokémon Legends: Arceus is set in Galar, 1,000 years in the past, where players must create the first Gigamax Pokéball. The upcoming game is inspired by Xenoblade Chronicles X.

As always, players should take this information with a grain of salt and note that all information is subject to change by the final release.

In other news, the full Pokémon Legends Z-A Pokédex, including Shinies and Megas, has been leaked online. Additionally, here’s the pre-load guide and file size for the upcoming title. item.title: Pokémon Gen 10 ‘Wind And Waves’ Story, Setting & New Mechanics Leak, It’s Claimed
item.content:encoded:
The Pokémon Company and Nintendo have suffered a massive leak, with datamined information revealing details about the Gen 10 games, seemingly called Pokémon Wind and Pokémon Waves.

With just a few days left for the release of Pokémon Legends Z-A, the upcoming game has already suffered from a massive leak, with its Pokedex surfacing online in its entirety. However, the leaks haven’t stopped there, as the new datamined information mentions the Gen 10 Pokémon Game, Wind and Waves. Players should know that the leaked documents are from 2021, so everything is subject to change.

Pokémon Wind and Waves Will ‘Infinity’ As the Theme

Thanks to a reputable source, CentroLeaks on X (formerly Twitter), several new details from the Pokémon Leak are surfacing online, including details about the Gen 10 title. The first thing is the name, which will be Pokémon Wind and Pokémon Waves. The upcoming game’s theme is Infinity and will be directed by Shigeru Ohmori, who is known for his work on games like Sun and Moon, Sword and Shield, and the Latest Scarlet and Violet.

The datamined information also states that the game’s original setting is Indonesia and Southeast Asia, contrary to earlier information pointing to Greece.

Gen 10 Legendary Pokémon

Coming to Legendary Pokémon, machine translation states that there are two of them, Package Storm and Package Wave. Package Storm’s role is that of an old man who possesses the power of the wind to properly guide humans and Pokémon. It lives on an island that keeps humans away and only accepts humans who have correctly raised seed Pokémon. The wave package is slightly different; its role is that of an old woman and possesses the power of waves to properly guide humans and Pokémon. The rest of the details are the same.

New Battle Mechanic and Seed Pokemon Systems

Coming on to Pokémon Gen 10, Winds\ and Waves, mechanics, and systems. The game will feature a new battle mechanic called Tenko-Waza, which can be translated as Weather Moves. The other system is the Seed Pokémon system, where a baby Pokémon of the Seed species can be found in resort areas.

The Seed Pokémon are the unevolved form of Pokémon that are rare in sight. It evolves when it travels to the island where the legendary Pokémon resides, and its evolutions are said to have infinite variations. Furthermore, it seems every Pokémon can be ridden or touched in the upcoming title.

Pokémon Wind and Waves Characters and Plot

The new leaks also reveal the characters and story in the upcoming Pokémon Gen 10 title. Starting with the protagonists, they are 13 years old, a city kid living in Kuala Lumpur who travels on vacation after their mother wins a lottery. The mother is 33 years old, raising two children, and is looking forward to the vacation. There is a baby who is said to be 0 years old; they cannot walk or talk, but learn to do so by the end of the story, “symbolizing the future”.

Next up is the friend, a local child residing on the resort island who serves as the protagonist’s rival. The child is knowledgeable about Pokémon and nature and becomes friends with the main character. Then we have the chairman of the hotel group who whos many resorts nationwide, their goal was for people and Pokémon to coexist with nature, but after their child was killed by a pokemon, they started hating them.

Then we have the ‘Heir’, who is the chairman’s child and also an executive in the organisation. The game doesn’t say it clearly, but their older brother has died, and they are either the second son or adopted. Then we have the evil team, or the ‘Land Development Team’, which destroys nature and expands land for profit. Lastly, we have the professor who is 21 years old, researching the relationship between weather and Pokémon.

Pokémon Wind and Waves Could Have an MMO Lobby, and Players Can Explore Underwater and Procedurally Generated Islands

Coming to the next bit, the upcoming title seems to start in a big tourist city rather than a small town. The adventure is set in a big resort hotel that apparently serves as a large MMO lobby, where players can see and interact with other players and access quest boards. However, this detail is from early development and could have been scrapped by Game Freak by now.

Moreover, the developers want to tackle a jungle environment in the Pokémon Gen 10 game, which hasn’t been fully explored in past games. Moreover, players will have the ability to explore underwater. Sticking to the infinity theme, the game will seemingly feature procedurally generated islands, meaning the region is “technically infinite” and ever-changing.

Pokémon Wind and Waves Features: MMO Raid Battle, Diving, New Graphics Engine, and More

Another post by CentroLeak on X tells us about the features Pokémon Wind and Wave will include:

  • Gym Adventure
  • Weather Move Acquisition Quest
  • Ride License Quest
  • MMO Raid Battle
  • Pokemon Rescue
  • Boss Pokémon that seem like a new version of Totem/Titan Pokémon
  • Pokemon Survival
  • Diving
  • New Graphics Engine: Pokemon Engine X

Pokemon Gen 10 Budget Leaks Online

Details about the development budgets for past, present, and upcoming Pokémon titles have surfaced online. The development budget for Scarlet and Violet DLC was 500 million Yen, the budget for Pokémon Legends Z-A was 2 billion yen, and the budget for Pokémon Wind and Waves is set at 3 billion yen.

Players should take all the leaked and datamined information with a grain of salt. Moreover, as the leaked documents are years old, any of the details mentioned above could have been scrapped or changed by now.

item.title: Why Are Battlefield 6 Challenges Not Tracking? When They Will Be Fixed, Explained
item.content:encoded:
Longevity shouldn’t be an issue in Battlefield 6 as the FPS has hundreds of challenges. From guns to general combat, there’s so much for you to do and keep on top of. It’s made slightly difficult when a few Battlefield 6 challenges don’t track, though, so let’s find out everything we know about why this is happening.

You’re not short of content and things to do in Battlefield 6. Between its Mastery Camos and Challenges, you’ve got stuff to keep you going until Battlefield 9 (slight hyperbole) at this point. At launch, BF 6 faced Challenge issues with the community complaining about certain objectives not tracking.

If this applies to you, we’ve got the latest from EA on the cause and potential fixes.

Battlefield 6 Challenges Not Tracking Issues, Explained

EA’s Community Manager has said: “Battlefield 6 is a live game, and some issues are expected at release.” This is the explanation for any challenges incorrectly tracking in Battlefield 6.

It’s not the deepest explanation ever, unfortunately, but it makes sense. You can do alpha and beta tests, as well as general open betas, all you want, but the fact is that mistakes can slip through the cracks with a game of this size, offering as much content as it does.

Expect them to be fixed when the devs get a chance.

Which Battlefield 6 Challenges Are Not Tracking?

Resupplying teammates and using Supply Crates are some examples of Challenges not tracking and working as they should in BF 6.

As of October 13, these are the challenges currently not tracking properly in Battlefield 6, according to EA’s Community Manager EA_Leeuw:

  • “Challenges: “Resupply teammates with the Supply Pouch” is not tracking progress.
  • Challenges: The Progress bar for “Repair Vehicles” does not update when repairs are made.
  • Challenges: “Use Vehicle Supply Crate” does not progress even after completing the action.
  • Challenges: The Weapon Expert Unit Challenge is not tracking correctly. The description says you must “Get a kill with each type of weapon in a match,” but the actual requirement is to get 15 longshot kills in a single match.
  • Assignments: Helicopters are incorrectly counted as Ground Vehicles in the “Land Vehicle Expert“ assignment.
  • Assignments: Helicopters are not counted properly in Vehicle Challenge 1.”

There’s every chance that as Challenges are fixed, more become broken: It’s the glorious roundabout of online FPS gaming. We’ve seen it for years with Call of Duty, and we fear that you Battlefield 6 players won’t have everything your own way. So keep your eyes peeled for more updates and patches for the Challenges not tracking.

When Will Battlefield 6 Challenges Be Fixed?

Battlefield 6 Challenges will be updated and fixed in “future updates.”

This information also comes from EA’s Community Manager. The only thing we can do is wait for more updates and patch notes. They will tell us what is being fixed, and checking the Battlefield Comms page is another way to see what the devs are working on.

Get down into the comments below and let us know if you’ve found any other Challenges that aren’t tracking, unrelated to the ones mentioned above. Also, head to the Insider Gaming Forum if there are more Battlefield 6 problems causing you a tank-sized headache.
